Another time.
In the age of wonder.
The opening sequence,

mythic, cool thing, where, you know,
the voice-over comes in all deep and low and talks about another age,

translation.ko: 짐 헨슨 작품 중에 가장 인간미가 있어요

translation.ko: 재미있게도 이 작품에는 사람이 전혀 등장하지 않지만요

It's such an incredibly all-encompassing, vivid world,
translation.ko: 모든 걸 아우르면서 아주 생생한 세계예요

translation.en: and the Skeksis are bloody scary.
[Taron] It's the only part where I've known
translation.ko: "브라이언 프라우드 다크 크리스탈의 세계" 이메일을 보기 전에

translation.en: I was gonna accept the part before opening the email.
The original Jim Henson film, like all of Jim Henson's work,
translation.ko: 짐 헨슨 영화 중에서도 특히 '라비린스'랑 '다크 크리스탈' 원작은

translation.en: but especially that and Labyrinth, were huge parts of my childhood.
translation.ko: 특히 '라비린스'랑 '다크 크리스탈' 원작은 제 어린 시절에 큰 영향을 줬어요

translation.en: I found them enchanting,
the right side of dark for my sensibilities,
and just completely other-worldly.
There was a book at the library of the making of The Dark Crystal.
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈' 제작에 관한 책이 도서관에 하나 있었어요

translation.en: You couldn't find the book anywhere, this was pre-Internet,
translation.ko: 다른 데는 없었고 인터넷이 없던 때라

I just remember it being quite an overwhelming experience, you know,
and, uh, everything about it, the visuals, the score...
I love the score. Another one of those movies
translation.ko: 음악이 좋아요 관점이 좀 바뀌게 되는 그런 영화 중 하나예요

translation.en: where you come out of the cinema slightly changed.
translation.ko: 관점이 좀 바뀌게 되는 그런 영화 중 하나예요

translation.en: Early memories I have of watching television with my father was The Muppet Show.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 아버지와 봤던 TV 쇼는 '머펫 쇼'였어요

translation.en: It was one of the few television shows he would watch.
translation.ko: 아버지가 보시는 몇 안 되는 TV 쇼였죠

translation.en: And then, he took me to see The Dark Crystal movie
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈'이 영화로 나오자 아버지는 저를 영화관에 데려가셨어요

translation.en: when it was in its theatrical run,
and it was just something we'd never seen before.
And it was so magical.
[Dave] I left the movie theater going, "Well, how... how did any of that happen?"
translation.ko: 영화관에서 나오며 생각했죠 '어떻게 저게 다 가능하지?'

translation.en: I got Podlings. I thought Podlings were a bit like Muppets. I get that.
And then, everything else, I just wanted to know how.
translation.ko: 그런데 나머지는 어떻게 한 건지 궁금했어요

translation.en: It's a game-changing film. So, if we go back and go, "Well, what can we do
translation.ko: 한 획을 그은 영화라서 대본과 미술, 세트 디자인을

translation.en: to match the level of script quality, art departments, set design, everything?"
translation.ko: 전부 어떻게 그 수준으로 만들 수 있을지 고민했어요

translation.en: With Dark Crystal, everything is built.
Everything is made specifically just for us.
It's based in reality, something tangible,
translation.ko: 현실을 바탕으로 했어요 손으로 만질 수 있고

translation.ko: 현실을 바탕으로 했어요 손으로 만질 수 있고 눈속임하지 않는 거요

translation.en: And the craftsmanship, the talent
translation.ko: 이 영화에 쏟은 재능과 솜씨는 정말...

translation.en: that has been brought to the table, is just... it's mind-blowing.
translation.ko: 이 영화에 쏟은 재능과 솜씨는 정말... 경이로워요

translation.en: Vast on every level. I mean, it was one of the biggest things
translation.ko: 모든 면에서 어마어마해요 우리 작업 중 최대 규모죠

translation.en: I think we've ever attempted
in terms of the amount of characters, the sophistication of the characters,
translation.ko: 캐릭터도 굉장히 많고 아주 정교하게 묘사했어요

translation.en: and also, the challenge of recreating things that already exist.
translation.ko: 원작 내용을 재창조하는 것도 이번 작품의 과제 중 하나였죠

translation.en: What fans of The Dark Crystal want is they want an odyssey, they want a saga,
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈' 팬들은 모험을 담은 영웅 전설을 원해요

translation.en: they want something to enrich the universe of the original film,
translation.ko: 원작보다 조금 더 다채로운 세계를 기대하죠

translation.en: and that's what this series does.
You could put them side by side, and it is the same world,
but there's just so much of it to explore now.
[Lisa] Imagine if you are in the puppetry business,
whether as a puppeteer or a puppet builder,
what bigger opportunity is ever gonna come you way
than ten episodes of Dark Crystal?
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈' 10부작 드라마보다 더 큰 기회가 있을까요?

translation.en: [narrator] A thousand years ago, this land was green and good,
translation.ko: 지금으로부터 천 년 전 크리스탈이 깨지기 전까지

translation.en: until the crystal cracked.
translation.ko: 이 땅은 온통 초록으로 덮여 있었다

translation.en: [Stephen] There's so much here that you don't know about.
There's an entire world to discover.
[Brian] I was working in London for five years as a jobbing illustrator,
and I needed to do my own work, but I didn't know exactly what that was.
translation.ko: 제 작품을 하고 싶었지만 그게 어떤 건지는 몰랐죠

translation.en: But once I got the opportunity to move to the country here,
translation.ko: 그런데 이 나라로 이사할 기회가 생겼고

translation.en: then, immediately, the first thing I painted
translation.ko: 여기 와서 트롤을 제일 먼저 그렸어요

translation.en: was, indeed, this picture of a troll with trees behind it
translation.ko: 여기 와서 트롤을 제일 먼저 그렸어요 나무를 배경으로 트롤 코에서 폭포가 쏟아지죠

translation.en: and a waterfall coming off its nose.
translation.ko: 나무를 배경으로 트롤 코에서 폭포가 쏟아지죠

translation.en: And that's what Jim saw.
And I was a bit overcome, I think, meeting Jim,
translation.ko: 짐을 만날 때 떨려서 무슨 말을 해야 할지

translation.en: and I didn't know quite what to say or how to express myself,
translation.ko: 저를 어떻게 표현할지 잘 몰랐던 것 같아요

translation.en: and it was his leap of faith.
[Cheryl] My father really wanted to do an epic fantasy adventure.
translation.ko: 아버지는 장대한 판타지 모험담을 만들고 싶어 하셨어요

translation.en: He really enjoyed doing comedy.
He enjoyed doing Muppets. He loved Sesame Street.
He loved the sort of fast, funny, vignette kind of variety show,
translation.ko: 그런 빠르고 유쾌한 버라이어티 쇼를 좋아하셨지만

translation.en: but he wanted to do something that really told a complex narrative.
translation.ko: 복잡한 이야기를 전하는 작품을 하고 싶어 하셨어요

translation.en: [Brian] But quite quickly, we were hiring people that had other skills,
translation.ko: 능력 있는 직원들을 여럿 영입하기 시작했어요

translation.en: and Wendy was brought on board
specifically for the Gelflings,
because Jim wanted that strong feminine thing.
It was all about bringing a character to life,
all about creating something you've never seen before
that he was hoping the audience would not only believe in,
translation.ko: 짐은 관람객들이 이 세계를 믿을 뿐만 아니라

translation.en: but also scratch their heads and go, "How do you do that?"
translation.ko: 대체 어떻게 한 건지 궁금해하길 바랐죠

translation.en: Hang on!
[Stephen] You have Brian Froud,
who is a guy who, for this world, these things are real.
translation.ko: 브라이언 프라우드에게는 이 세계가 모두 진짜였고

translation.en: You have Frank Oz,
who is one of the most brilliant puppeteers who's ever lived,
translation.ko: 역사상 가장 뛰어난 인형극 배우 중 하나였죠

translation.en: and you have Jim bringing the world-building, and the humanity,
and the sense of human nature being put into these puppets.
It's a brilliant kind of creative melting pot
that brought the original thing to life.
[Taron] We live in an age of sequels and prequels,
but the great thing about The Dark Crystal is
it's such a microcosmic look at the world that, when you finish watching it,
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈'이 특별한 건 세상의 축소판이라서죠 작품을 다 보면

translation.en: you're left with these massive questions about the universe at large which have never been answered.
translation.ko: 그동안 아무도 설명하지 못한 신비로운 우주에 의문을 품게 돼요

translation.en: [Cheryl] There are people who obsess about Dark Crystal, who really care about Dark Crystal,
and over the years, it's really become a cult film.
translation.ko: 시간이 흐르면서 이게 컬트 영화가 됐어요

translation.en: [Stephen] Is there going to be a feature film sequel?
Is there gonna be an animated TV show?
I don't think that you could have done
translation.ko: 그 누구도 NETFLIX보다 새로운 '다크 크리스탈'을 잘 만들진 못했을 거예요

translation.en: a new version of The Dark Crystal better than on Netflix
translation.ko: 새로운 '다크 크리스탈'을 잘 만들진 못했을 거예요 그들은 충분한 예산을 들여 헨슨 제작팀과 함께 작업했죠

translation.en: with the right budget, with the creative team that Henson assembled.
translation.ko: 그들은 충분한 예산을 들여 헨슨 제작팀과 함께 작업했죠

translation.en: I mean, it's so exciting to see the world come back to life in that way.
translation.ko: 그 세계가 다시 살아 숨 쉬게 돼서 정말 기뻐요

translation.en: All too often, projects are rebooted or remade based on an IP
translation.ko: 지식 재산권을 바탕으로 원작을 새롭게 만드는 게 일반적이긴 한데 그러면 사람들이 좋아하던

translation.en: where all the DNA of that thing that makes people love it is discarded.
translation.ko: 일반적이긴 한데 그러면 사람들이 좋아하던 그 작품만의 DNA가 다 사라져요

translation.en: But, for me, if you're going to remake or reboot a franchise,
translation.ko: 그런데 사실 프랜차이즈를 새롭게 부활시킬 거라면

translation.en: go back to why people like it in the first place.
[Cindy] Teddy Biaselli had told me that Henson were interested
translation.ko: 테드가 말하기를 헨슨은 원래 이 작품을

translation.en: in doing an animated series of The Dark Crystal,
translation.ko: 애니메이션으로 만들고 싶어 했다길래 저도 고민했어요

translation.en: and I thought about it, and I went home and I watched the movie again.
translation.ko: 애니메이션으로 만들고 싶어 했다길래 저도 고민했어요 집에 가서 영화를 다시 봤죠

translation.en: I kept thinking about it. I was, like, "Well the mythology is great,
translation.ko: 그런데 이 작품이 그리는 신화도 훌륭하지만

translation.en: but what makes it really special and transcendent is the puppets."
translation.ko: 정말 특별하고 탁월한 점은 인형이라는 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: [Ted] I picked up the phone. I was, like, "Okay, good news, bad news.
translation.ko: 전화를 걸어서 좋은 소식과 나쁜 소식을 전했어요

translation.en: Uh, bad news is, we're not gonna make The Dark Crystal animated series.
translation.ko: 나쁜 소식은 애니메이션 시리즈로 만들지 않겠다는 거였고

translation.en: The good news is Cindy wants to know what it would cost to do it live-action."
translation.ko: 좋은 소식은 신디가 실사 촬영 비용을 물어봤다는 거죠

translation.en: And you could hear the phone hit the floor.
translation.ko: 그러자 전화기가 바닥에 떨어지는 소리가 들렸어요

translation.en: And we were shocked.
[laughs] Like, "Really? A series that looks like the film?"
And, of course... of course we immediately responded
that it's yes, like, it's technically possible,
translation.ko: 저희는 물론... 당연히 바로 대답했죠 기술적으로는 가능한데 제작비가 엄청날 거라고요

translation.en: but it will be very expensive.
[Cindy] The best version of The Dark Crystal that could be made today,
translation.ko: 오늘날 '다크 크리스탈'을 가장 잘 제작할 수 있는 곳은

translation.en: would be made by the Henson Company,
by giving them the freedom
to really reach for the best version they can possibly imagine.
translation.ko: 최고의 작품을 마음껏 만들어 보게 하는 거예요

translation.en: -[gasps] -[laughs] Gelfling!
And they picked up a teaser, a test,
to see what it looked like.
[Lisa] Netflix could look at the test and see the same thing that we saw in it.
translation.ko: NETFLIX도 테스트 영상을 보면 우리와 같은 느낌을 받을 테니

translation.en: So what we had tried to do in the test
was we did CG Gelfling with puppet Skeksis.
translation.ko: 그 테스트 영상에선 겔플링은 CG로 처리하고 스켁시스는 인형을 이용했어요

translation.en: Trespasser!
[Andy] Does it make sense to do a TV show
translation.ko: 말이 안 되죠 원작 영화의 방식으로 TV 드라마를 만든다니요

translation.en: in the same way that they did the original film?
translation.ko: 원작 영화의 방식으로 TV 드라마를 만든다니요

translation.en: You know, how much has, of-- has technology progressed?
[Skeksis] What's that smell?
There's something disparate
between a real tactile object that catches the light,
translation.ko: 빛을 받아서 층이 지고 질감이 사는 것과

translation.en: that is layered and textured,
versus something that is generated in a computer.
And no matter how good it looks, no matter how good it looks,
they looked like two different mediums.
[Lisa] We could make a clean marriage between the two.
translation.ko: 물론 그 둘을 잘 조합할 수는 있었어요

translation.en: And, technically, it could be done,
but the CG Gelfling didn't look like Gelflings.
translation.ko: CG로 만든 겔플링은 겔플링 같지 않았어요

translation.en: [Ritamarie] No matter what you did with the eyes of the puppet,
those puppet glass eyes were so hard to replicate
translation.ko: 인형의 유리 눈을 CG로 구현하는 건

translation.en: in a CG environment,
that you immediately could see
that it was CG talking to the puppet,
translation.ko: 인형과 말하는 게 바로 눈에 띄게 되고

translation.en: then you really just wanted to see the puppet.
[Erik] Seeing the tests that they did before the shoot
with full CGI character and a puppet,
it was... I mean, it's like night and day.
It's amazing how much more evocative the... the puppet is.
[Alice] As masterful as it is,
you can't talk to a Pixar character in the real world.
translation.ko: 현실에서 픽사 캐릭터와 대화할 순 없죠

translation.en: I mean, the percentage of the audience that gets to come
and talk to a puppet in the real world is very small,
translation.ko: 실제로 대화할 관객도 많지는 않을 거예요

translation.en: but I think you know that you could.
[Louise] We're going back to telling the story and what serves that,
translation.ko: 우리가 이야기를 부활시킬 때 이런 효과들을 쓰면

translation.en: not just, "These effects are such fun,
let's-- how much more effects can we do?"
translation.ko: 얼마나 많은 효과를 쓸 수 있을까요?

translation.en: How do the effects serve the story? What can they tell?
[Andy] CG, they can expand your world, they can enhance it and augment it,
translation.ko: CG는 우리 세계를 더 확장하고 강화할 수 있어요

translation.en: and they can totally take it to places that just sets can't and just puppets can't,
translation.ko: 세트장과 인형만으로는 얻을 수 없는 경험을 선사하지만

translation.en: but they can't be the star of the show, and they shouldn't be the star,
translation.ko: CG가 주역이 될 순 없고 그래서도 안 돼요

translation.en: because then you do lose that humanity, and it does jar you out of it.
translation.ko: 그럼 인간미를 잃게 되고 몰입도를 떨어뜨리니까요

translation.en: And we all looked around at each other and said,
"We're doing it all with puppets, guys."
And Double Negative, the studio that did the CG,
translation.ko: 그러자 CG를 담당한 더블 네거티브 스튜디오에서

translation.en: said, "Well, hold on. We want to show you something."
Take just a shot from the movie, and then just manipulate it,
translation.ko: 영화 한 장면을 조작해서 눈을 좀 깜빡이거나 미소를 만들 수 있어요

translation.en: so you can add a little bit of blink or a little bit of smile,
translation.ko: 눈을 좀 깜빡이거나 미소를 만들 수 있어요

translation.en: and just take the performance from the puppet just that little bit further to add a bit more life to it.
translation.ko: 그리고 인형 연기를 조금 더 생동감 있게 만들고요

translation.en: And they augmented Kira's face a little bit.
That gave it a little bit more pop of life.
And we all went... [snaps fingers] "That's it."
[Lisa] We, as a company, have been doing puppets for over 50 years,
and to be here at this point, so many years later,
translation.ko: 오랜 세월을 지나 지금 여기까지 왔고

translation.en: and be doing what has got to be the biggest puppet production ever.
translation.ko: 역사상 최대 규모일 인형극을 지금 제작하고 있어요

translation.en: This has no humans, so it is a complete puppet extravaganza.
translation.ko: 인간 배우가 안 나오니 완전한 인형들만의 호화 쇼죠

translation.en: My writing partner and I came up with a pitch for a sequel to Labyrinth,
and we called and we're like, "There's these two guys,
translation.ko: 전화를 걸어서 '라비린스' 속편 구상을 들어 보시겠냐고 했더니

translation.en: they have an idea for Labyrinth. Do you wanna hear it for a sequel?
Henson Company was like, "No, but we're doing Dark Crystal,
translation.ko: 헨슨 컴퍼니에서 거절하면서 '다크 크리스탈'을 제작 중이니 거기 참여해 보라더군요

translation.en: Would you want to come in on that?"
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈'을 제작 중이니 거기 참여해 보라더군요

translation.en: We're sitting there and this French gentleman comes in, says,
translation.ko: 그래서 만나러 갔는데 '루이'라는 프랑스 남자가 리사를 만나러 왔다고 했죠

translation.en: "Hello, I'm Louis, I'm here to meet with Lisa."
translation.ko: '루이'라는 프랑스 남자가 리사를 만나러 왔다고 했죠

translation.en: And we realize we're pitching Lisa Henson
translation.ko: 거기서 리사 헨슨과 '인크레더블 헐크'의 감독 앞에서

translation.en: and the guy who directed Hulk.
And so, we have to suddenly act like we know what we're doing.
translation.ko: 그래서 갑자기 막 자신 있는 척을 해야 했어요

translation.en: We turn, look, and we see the archer, except the hunter--
[Blanca] The way they pitched the idea of the show

It had high stakes, drama, intimacy,
translation.ko: 위험한 모험과 드라마도 있고 친밀감도 있고 악당도 완벽했죠

translation.en: and, of course, great villains.
So, we were all really in awe,
translation.ko: 저희 모두 좋아서 입을 다물 수가 없었고

translation.en: and our... our hearts were full of joy
translation.ko: 이 세계를 다시 살아 숨 쉬게 해 줄 사람을 찾아서

translation.en: to see that we found the right person to bring this back to life again.
translation.ko: 이 세계를 다시 살아 숨 쉬게 해 줄 사람을 찾아서 정말 기뻤어요

translation.en: And as he falls back, and that is where Aughra manages to emerge...
[Carolina] The level of passion and excitement when they're telling a story
translation.ko: 작가가 잔뜩 들떠서 이야기를 풀어내는 모습에

translation.en: had us engaged right away.
So when they spoke the story to us, we were, like, all leaning in.
translation.ko: 그 이야기를 들을 때 저희 모두 귀를 쫑긋 세우고

translation.en: We're like, "What is this? What is this?" And that transferred onto the page.
translation.ko: 이게 뭐냐며 흥분했죠 그걸 종이에 옮겼고요

translation.en: If you weren't incredibly familiar with the original film
translation.ko: 만약 원작 영화를 제대로 알지 못했거나

translation.en: and didn't have a passion for it,
it might be too hard to decide how to build up this very elaborate prequel.
translation.ko: 이렇게 정교한 프리퀄을 구상하는 게 정말 어려웠을 거예요

translation.en: We're looking at telling ten hours of modern television,
and it's 30 years after the original Dark Crystal came out.
So, we can't just live with the idea that we're introducing a new world,
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈' 원작이 나온 지 30년이나 됐으니 새로운 세계를 소개하는 것만으론 부족하다고 생각했어요

translation.en: the world has existed for 30 years.
So, we had to break a lot of the narrative conceits of the film,
translation.ko: 그래서 원작 영화의 서술 장치와 시각 장치를

translation.en: a lot of the visual conceits of the film, and be free to do that.
translation.ko: 많이 바꿔야 했고 자유롭게 해야 했죠

translation.en: [Will] And so you can't go into that with like, "And here's how I'd do it."
translation.ko: 그냥 '이렇게 해야지' 하며 일을 시작할 순 없어요

translation.en: You gotta go in with like,
"Okay, what do you like about what you're doing,
translation.ko: 일단 생각해야 해요 그럼 이건 어떻게 하는 게 좋을지

translation.en: [stammers] what needs a little more life, what needs a little fleshing out,
translation.ko: 뭘 좀 더 살릴지 뭐에 살을 붙일지

translation.en: what's got too much fleshing out?"
[Ted] Jeff and Will, brilliant writers,
never worked on television before in their life.
translation.ko: 방송 일은 한 번도 안 해 봤고요

translation.en: We weren't about to literally throw them in the deep end without any sort of help.
translation.ko: 그래서 전혀 도와주지 않고 그냥 맡길 수는 없는 상황이었어요

translation.en: So I go into the meeting, and I'm ushered into Lisa Henson's office.
translation.ko: 회의가 있어서 리사 헨슨의 사무실로 들어갔죠

translation.en: And there's Lisa, and Halle, and Blanca.
And he came in and he didn't know what he was there for.
translation.ko: 아마 우리가 왜 불렀는지 몰랐을 텐데

translation.en: He was excited though.
And we said, "We're gonna show you something."
translation.ko: 우리가 보여 줄 게 있다고 했어요

translation.en: [Javier] And then they show me this five-minute trailer that they shot
as a proof of concept.
And the story's been told enough times that I'm not entirely sure what happened.
translation.ko: 워낙 오래된 이야기라 어떻게 된 건지 어리둥절했죠

translation.en: [Halle] He was so excited and so happy.
I think he man-cried. I mean, I think he basically man-cried.
translation.ko: 운 것 같아요 몰래 울었을 거예요

translation.en: I think on the outside I was able to keep a good poker face, but on the inside, I went into like a full-on, ugly man-cry
translation.ko: 겉으로는 무표정이었던 것 같은데 속으로는 진짜 엉엉 울어버렸어요

translation.en: for, like, my lost innocence, and my childhood,
and for all the things I'd loved as a kid.
And I couldn't say no to the job. It was just one of those things, like,
translation.ko: 거절할 수 없었죠 이런 일은 1달러를 준대도

translation.en: you could offer me a dollar... [laughs] and I'm gonna do this job, you know?
translation.ko: 이런 일은 1달러를 준대도 기꺼이 할 거예요

translation.en: [Will] The minute he walked in the room, you knew he was a huge fan of the property.
translation.ko: 그가 딱 들어왔는데 작품을 정말 좋아하더라고요

translation.en: and he was a huge fan of process.
He immediately set a tone of professionalism and nerd joy.
Are you nuts? Why would you re-make something so great?
translation.ko: 처음엔 그런 걸작을 왜 리메이크하나 했어요

translation.en: Uh, and then I read the script.
And then I saw they're making it into a TV series and it was a prequel.
translation.ko: 이게 TV 드라마고 프리퀄이란 걸 알게 됐어요

translation.en: I saw the people that were involved and I thought, "Oh, I get it.
You're really digging deep into the world and you can do so many more things now."
translation.ko: 더 많은 이야기를 하려고 더 깊게 다루는 거였어요

translation.en: [Lisa] Louis came to us a long time ago
because he wanted to know what we were doing with The Dark Crystal at the time we were developing a feature film.
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈' 장편 영화를 어떻게 구상하는지 궁금하다고요

translation.en: He jumped on board the feature film and worked with us on that development
translation.ko: 루이도 영화에 뛰어들었고 저희와 함께 '다크 크리스탈'을

translation.en: on how to do Dark Crystal for today.
translation.ko: 루이도 영화에 뛰어들었고 저희와 함께 '다크 크리스탈'을 어떻게 오늘날에 맞출지 구상했죠

translation.en: And he is the one person on the whole show
who... who has the show in his head.
He's incredibly thoughtful,
and I feel like he's really the right person
to be standing in my father's shoes from the original movie,
where people can, like, ask him,
"All right, what are we doing here?" [laughs] You know?
He... he's that person who knows.
[Javier] The Dark Crystal was heavy with the weight of legacy.
translation.ko: 그 대단한 유산 때문에 '다크 크리스탈'이 버거웠어요

translation.en: Legacy because all of us grew up with Jim Henson.
translation.ko: 우리 모두 짐 헴슨 영화를 보고 자랐잖아요

translation.en: Legacy because The Dark Crystal was a huge movie
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈'은 수많은 영화 팬들에게 특히 장르 영화 팬들에게

translation.en: for a lot of us who love cinema and especially who love genre cinema.
translation.ko: 수많은 영화 팬들에게 특히 장르 영화 팬들에게 엄청난 인기를 끈 영화고요

translation.en: But the trick is to find that sweet spot where you still are able to be honest,
translation.ko: 적당한 지점을 찾는 게 특히 더 어려웠어요 여전히 순수해 보일 수 있고

translation.en: you're still able to be respectful, and you're still able to be creative.
translation.ko: 원작을 여전히... 존중하면서 창의적일 수 있는 지점요

translation.en: [Lisa] Louis is not a writer, um, but he was in the writing room the whole time.
translation.ko: 루이는 작가가 아니지만 작가실에 항상 있었어요

translation.en: So, we did a writing room in Los Angeles with Jeff, and Will, and Javier,
and Jo Lee, and Vivian.
We had a nice team of writers.
And then, Louis worked with them even closer,
and you know, rarely left the room.
[Vivian] Will and Jeff had already thought of the ten episodes,
so they did a lot of the heavy lifting for us.
translation.ko: 힘든 부분을 정말 많이 해 준 거죠

translation.en: So, we knew where we were going.
There was so much communication,
about where the canon was going,
and sort of what were important aspects to make sure that we didn't change,
translation.ko: 어떤 부분이 중요한지 뭘 바꾸고 안 바꿀지

translation.en: or things that we did make sure that were the tent poles.
[Lisa] Jo Lee is writing the YA books, and he's a big world creator.
translation.ko: 조 리는 청소년 소설을 쓰고 아주 방대한 세계를 만들어내요

translation.en: We've used a lot of what he developed in his YA books
translation.ko: 이 시리즈가 전하는 이야기 구조와 배경으로

translation.en: as texture and background for the story that the series tells.
translation.ko: 그가 자기 소설에서 개발한 것들을 많이 이용했어요

translation.en: Writing the novels, it was a lot about, like,
translation.ko: 소설을 쓸 때 큰 비중을 차지하는 건

translation.en: making up place names, and character names, and environments,
translation.ko: 장소 이름과 캐릭터 이름과 환경을 만들어내는 거죠

translation.en: and now, I'm just one piece in a very big picture.
translation.ko: 저는 아주 큰 그림에서 한 부분일 뿐이에요

translation.en: What was this incredible civilization that the Skeksis wiped out?
translation.ko: 스켁시스가 다 파괴해버린 이 놀라운 문명은 뭐였을까요?

translation.en: That world building which sort of occurred across the YA novels
translation.ko: 여러 청소년 소설과 그래픽 노블을 통해서

translation.en: and across the graphic novels,
you know, we kind of just created, like, that civilization,
translation.ko: 그 세계관을 구축했고 그냥 그 문명을 만든 셈이에요

translation.en: which is a matriarchal society.
Seven clans which are each run by their own Maudra, who's the matriarch,
translation.ko: 일곱 씨족을 여성 족장인 모드라들이 각각 이끌고요

translation.en: and then all the Maudras. The queen of all of them is the All-Maudra.
And she is of the Vapra Clan,
so we actually created seven different clans
translation.ko: 우린 서로 다른 일곱 씨족을 만들었는데

translation.en: which are not based on any human culture,
translation.ko: 어떤 인간 문화를 바탕으로 만들진 않았지만

translation.en: but what they're a little bit based on is the way that human cultures are different from each other.
translation.ko: 인간 문화가 어떻게 서로 다른지 조금 반영하긴 했어요

translation.en: [Simon] Certainly, in science fiction and fantasy,
you have realms whereby you can rehearse ideas
translation.ko: 어떤 아이디어를 연습할 수 있는 영역이 있죠

translation.en: that might not necessarily be possible in the real world.
You can actually present power struggles
translation.ko: 권력 싸움을 묘사하거나 어떤 배경을 나타낼 수 있죠

translation.en: or at least environments where things aren't necessarily dictated
translation.ko: 권력 싸움을 묘사하거나 어떤 배경을 나타낼 수 있죠 지금 이곳의 성 정치 문제를 굳이 반영하지 않더라도요

translation.en: by the gender politics of the now, here,
translation.ko: 지금 이곳의 성 정치 문제를 굳이 반영하지 않더라도요

translation.en: and to show how changes can occur.
translation.ko: 어떻게 변할 수 있을지 보여 줘요

translation.en: [Halle] High fantasy, like all good storytelling,
translation.ko: 모든 좋은 이야기처럼 하이 판타지엔 캐릭터 배경도 있고

translation.en: has a character story, has a plot story that drives the action.
translation.ko: 모든 좋은 이야기처럼 하이 판타지엔 캐릭터 배경도 있고 사건을 진행하는 줄거리도 있지만

translation.en: But the thing I think high fantasy can do
probably better than any type of storytelling
translation.ko: 하이 판타지가 더 크고 전반적인 메시지를

translation.en: is it can send that bigger, overall message,
translation.ko: 하이 판타지가 더 크고 전반적인 메시지를 더 잘 전할 수 있는 것 같아요

translation.en: not only to bringing people into this wondrous new world,
but also speaking to some issues right now
translation.ko: 새롭고 신비한 세계로 사람들을 데려가면서도 현재의 문제를 이야기해요

translation.en: that, uh, we all are feeling very strongly.
translation.ko: 우리 모두가 아주 절실히 느끼는 문제를요

translation.en: And seeing it in myth, and a new myth, it's gonna be very exciting.
translation.ko: 새로운 신화에서 그걸 보게 되는 거죠 재미있을 거예요

translation.en: [Natalie] It pulls on that idea of unity
against an overriding darkness and evil.
translation.ko: 압도적인 어둠과 악에 대항해서 통합이라는 개념을 끌어내요

translation.en: All storytelling is about who we are, and what we do,
translation.ko: 모든 이야기는 우리가 누구고 뭘 하고 어떻게 행동하고

translation.en: and how we behave, and what choices we make.
Uh, and sometimes it's naturalistic, sometimes it's through a fantasy prism.
translation.ko: 때로는 사실적이고 때로는 판타지 프리즘을 쓰죠

translation.en: But with this, when it's through creatures that don't look like us,
translation.ko: 그런데 이건 우리와 너무 다른 세계에서

translation.en: from a world that is so far away from us,
it makes us let our guard down.
We don't notice that we're really talking about how human beings behave.
translation.ko: 사실 인간이 어떻게 행동하는지 얘기하고 있다는 걸 눈치 못 채요

translation.en: [Javier] What are the tent-pole moments we have to hit?
We know that the pilot is the Gelfling discover
that the Skeksis are draining the Gelfling for their essence.
translation.ko: 스켁시스가 겔플링에게서 에센스를 빼낸다는 걸 알아내요

translation.en: So we know that's the inciting incident.
You know, we know, we know, we know. So you start putting those tent poles up on a white board,
translation.ko: 이거랑 저거랑 그거랑 칠판에 중심 사건을 막 붙이는데

translation.en: and what that gives you is,
it gives you, if not a road map, a set of destinations.
And the creativity comes out of
you sit in a room, and this is how we did Lost also.
You sit in a room day after day, and go, "Okay, how do we get
translation.ko: 그냥 앉아서 A에서 B까지 C에서 D까지 어떻게 갈지 매일 생각하죠

translation.en: from point A, to point B, to point C, to point D?"
translation.ko: A에서 B까지 C에서 D까지 어떻게 갈지 매일 생각하죠

translation.en: Next thing you know, you have a season of television.
translation.ko: 그러다 보면 드라마 한 시즌이 나와요

translation.en: And from there, that's when you build a world.
translation.ko: 거기서부터 세계를 만들어요 어떤 캐릭터를 만든다고 하면...

translation.en: If you... you create a character such as...
translation.ko: 거기서부터 세계를 만들어요 어떤 캐릭터를 만든다고 하면... '브레아'를 예로 들어 볼게요

translation.en: I'm gonna use an example like Brea.
So, she's a princess, which means there's a mother who's a queen,
which means, oh, there's a hierarchy, this, uh, legacy that she has to live.
translation.ko: 즉, 계급 사회라는 뜻이고 유산을 이어가야 한다는 거죠

translation.en: What's that landscape like?
It's just a slow unravel, and it's very beautiful, and it's very delicate.
translation.ko: 이렇게 서서히 풀어가요 아주 아름답고 섬세한 작업이죠

translation.en: We wanted to make sure that we also had a love story at its core.
And it's the story of Rian and Deet.
And I think that these two characters need to meet
translation.ko: 이 두 캐릭터가 만나야 한다고 생각했어요

translation.en: and go on this journey together.
That's it! Monsters.

who's one of our writers on the show and who had a background in linguistics.

of all the Podling and English words, and so I learned it by studying Jo Lee's diligent work.
translation.ko: 포들링 언어를 영어로 풀이한 거죠 전 그걸로 포들링 언어를 배웠어요

translation.en: [J.M.] He's done a huge amount to breathe life into it.
He'll write me emails in Podling,
and I'm like,"I don't... I don't know what that says."
translation.ko: 포들링 언어로 저한테 이메일을 보내는데 뜻을 모르겠어요

translation.en: Like... [laughs] I made up the language, but I'm not fluent in it.
translation.ko: 제가 만든 언어지만 유창하게 쓰진 못해요

translation.en: So, it's very inclusive for everyone.
Every idea on this counts,
like, figuring out how is he gonna shoot that arrow,
translation.ko: 화살을 어떻게 쏠지 생각해 내는 것도요

translation.en: because he also had four hands and he can go like this.
translation.ko: 손이 4개라서 이렇게 화살을 쏠 수 있거든요

translation.en: What if he also goes behind his head
and shoots up in the air like that with those arms going up?
translation.ko: 팔을 이렇게 올려 공중에 쏘면 어떨까요?

translation.en: [Javier] At one point in the writer's room, somebody comes up with,
"We should have a scene where Podlings are being washed,"
and that just goes over there some place.
And then, somebody says,
"We should send Brea to, like, some group of people
who just do crap jobs and they're really unhappy."
And then, you give it to a talented writer like Vivian.
Next thing you know, the daughter is going to The Deterge, and there's a season where you wash Podlings.
translation.ko: 포들링이 갑자기 '정화'를 하고 포들링이 씻는 계절이 따로 생겨요

translation.en: And, by the way, that's also a good example
of what I refer to as "wide open spaces."
Having written a Star Trek movie, I know what it's like when you write,
translation.ko: '스타트렉' 각본을 써 봐서 어떤 작업인지 저도 알아요

translation.en: "And such-and-such lands on such-and-such planet."
And you know someone's gonna have to go build that, or design it or, or all of those things.
translation.ko: 누군가 그걸 만들거나 디자인하거나 둘 다 해야겠죠

translation.en: But I think, as a writer, you have to trust in the process.
translation.ko: 하지만 작가는 그런 과정을 믿어야 해요

translation.en: You can't think about the designers and the builders.
translation.ko: 디자인이나 모형을 미리 생각하면 안 돼요

translation.en: They have to take care of themselves. You write whatever the heck you wanna write.
translation.ko: 그건 전문가한테 맡기고 그냥 쓰고 싶은 걸 써야 해요

translation.en: However vast and expansive it is, you just write it
translation.ko: 아무리 방대하고 광활하더라도 그냥 써야 해요

translation.en: and let them tell you they can't do it. It's not your problem.
translation.ko: 구현하지 못하는 건 다른 문제죠 작가 문제가 아니에요

translation.en: For Dark Crystal to be able to work,
we had to have that full trust in the creative vision.
I don't know where else you could make an epic,
action, adventure, fantasy, romance, story of love
translation.ko: 판타지와 로맨스가 있는 이야기를 어떻게 만들겠어요?

translation.en: with puppets, and have it be this epic.
The mantra is freedom and responsibility.
People at all levels within Netflix
do have a lot of freedom to do their jobs how they see fit,
translation.ko: 어떤 식으로 일할지 자유롭게 정할 수 있지만

translation.en: but you're accountable.
So, there's a responsibility for delivering at a really high level.
translation.ko: 아주 높은 수준으로 일을 완수해야 하죠

translation.en: And we extend that same mantra to our filmmakers.
translation.ko: 우리 제작진에게도 그 만트라를 똑같이 적용해요

translation.en: [Taron] Before I was an actor, the thing that really sort of set my soul on fire
translation.ko: 배우가 되기 전에 그림과 조각, 캐릭터 구축에

translation.en: was drawing, and sculpting, and making characters.
and that's sort of what I thought my life was going to be about.
And I just remembered the first time that I opened the printout with the character breakdown and the little image,
translation.ko: 캐릭터 설명과 그림을 처음 출력했을 때가 기억나요

translation.en: that I just called, like, anyone who I thought might be interested
to tell them about it, because it was just the coolest thing.
There's something to be said about the way something is moving in real space,
translation.ko: 현실 공간에서 물체가 빛을 받으며 움직이는 방식이에요

translation.en: with the light catching it and that tactile sense,
translation.ko: 빛을 받으면서 촉감이 느껴지며 생동감이 들죠

translation.en: then bringing it to life.
[Lisa] We were nervous about doing puppet Gelfling,
and it came from my father's concern
that the Gelfling hadn't been entirely successful in the first movie.
translation.ko: 아버지의 원작 영화에서 겔플링이 썩 좋진 않았어요

translation.en: The designs were beautiful. I mean, Wendy did an incredible job,
translation.ko: 디자인은 아름다웠고 웬디도 정말 잘해 줬지만

translation.en: but, like, the movement was not quite what he wanted.
They were sure that they were gonna be able to do
things that were far easier, far better,
it wouldn't be difficult this time.
And they ran into the same problems,
because, basically, it's a hand in a very small head,
translation.ko: 결국 아주 작은 머리에 손을 넣고 하는 거잖아요

translation.en: and there isn't a lot you can do with that.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 게 많지 않죠

translation.en: You still need to have a lot of room for mechanisms up above
translation.ko: 장치를 달 공간도 위쪽에 많이 필요하고

translation.en: and enough room for a hand to manipulate the mouth.
translation.ko: 손을 넣어서 입을 조종할 공간도 필요해요

translation.en: I think what's going to step up our new characters
translation.ko: 새로운 캐릭터에서 더 좋아진 부분은 아마 눈과 피부 질감에

translation.en: is how we were able to get the character into the eyes
translation.ko: 더 좋아진 부분은 아마 눈과 피부 질감에 개성을 더할 수 있었다는 거겠죠

translation.en: and into the skin texture.
We think the Gelflings are so much improved,
it's almost hard to look back and remember
why I was nervous about doing puppet Gelfling.
But my father was nervous enough about it
that he wanted to cast humans in Labyrinth.
[John] Don't get me wrong, the original stuff is magical in its own right.
translation.ko: 오해하지 마세요 원작의 인형도 정말 훌륭해요

translation.en: You know, back then, they would carve out fingers out of wood.
translation.ko: 그때는 나무를 조각해서 손가락을 만들곤 했어요

translation.en: Now we're-- we have 3D printed fingers, um, out of plastic.
It's really... the design is fundamentally based on
what we know they built on the original movie,
um, which is basically this skull... or partial skull...
um, with the teeth mounted kind of below it on a wire.
And you think it's not bad,
but a puppeteer has to have it on their hand for hours.
translation.ko: 괜찮아 보이지만 인형극 배우는 이걸 몇 시간 동안 손에 끼고 있어야 해요

translation.en: But the skins, um, are foam-latex,
um, as they were on the original,
um, which is very light, uh, and flexible, uh, material.
This is the core,
and... and this is the actual, uh, detail itself inside.
So, it's got... we've got two molds going on here in...
in theory.
So, this is the core mold,
which we get our fiberglass outside that goes inside it for the animatronics,
translation.ko: 애니메트로닉스용으로 겉의 유리 섬유를 안으로 넣어요

translation.en: and inside here is the detail.
[Jasper] The inside...
of the skin is actually exactly the same shape as the outside of the skull.
translation.ko: 사실 두개골 겉면이랑 모양이 완전히 똑같아요

translation.en: So, I cut this character in half right there,
and what that does is it allows me to make a tray.
translation.ko: 그렇게 하면 저는 트레이를 만들 수 있죠

translation.en: And from that tray, I just start building off.
So, this is the main hero Aughra puppet, um,
that Kevin uses most often. Um...
But, um, this is sort of its clone.
Um, she has a foam latex skin,
uh, like the original did.
And then, inside, she ends up with, uh, her ugly Aughra teeth
translation.ko: 못생긴 오그라 치아가 안에 들어가게 되고요

translation.en: and a foam mouth a lot like that one.
So, he grips it like this.
And is able to make her talk that way. But then, there is...
translation.ko: 그렇게 입을 움직이는데 그리고 무선으로도 조종해요

translation.en: additionally, there is a radio control that gives a second puppeteer expression
translation.ko: 그렇게 입을 움직이는데 그리고 무선으로도 조종해요 두 번째 인형극 배우가

translation.en: over her eyebrows and her eye.
Technology is great. There are a lot of things
translation.ko: 기술이 정말 좋고 그때는 못 했지만

translation.en: that you can do now that you couldn't do then,
translation.ko: 지금은 할 수 있는 게 많아요

translation.en: but, when it comes right down to it,
it's still, basically, a hand in a head.
translation.ko: 하지만 결국에는 여전히... 인형 머리에 손을 넣어야 해요

translation.en: [Brian] You know, when I do it, it's just a drawing. It's a few scribbles.
translation.ko: 제가 작업할 땐 그냥 그림이에요 그냥 낙서죠

translation.en: They've got to sculpt it, and it's in clay.
And it's a dead thing,
and you've got to make sure that somehow that has life.
translation.ko: 생물이 아니니 어떻게 해서든 생기를 불어넣어야죠

translation.en: Then it's made into a mold, which is a dead... you know, a dead thing,
and then it's cast into this strange thing that is rubber...
that has its own life but has nothing to do with what you're doing.
translation.ko: 뭔가 탄생하지만 아직은 아무것도 못 해요

translation.en: And then you've got somebody who's gonna make mechanics in it
translation.ko: 거기서 누군가 안에 장치를 넣어 주죠

translation.en: that are just solid and only do a few things,
translation.ko: 그냥 튼튼하고 몇 가지만 하는 장치요

translation.en: and you've got to try and get those things together.
And it's got to now express some life, and then you give it to the puppeteer.
translation.ko: 생동감이 좀 표현되는데 그때 인형극 배우에게 줘요

translation.en: [Peter] It's another challenge for a show like this,
translation.ko: 이런 작품에선 우리가 배우를 창조한다는 점이

translation.en: is that we're creating the actors for the show.
translation.ko: 이런 작품에선 우리가 배우를 창조한다는 점이 또 하나의 도전이에요 속임수가 아니죠

translation.en: They're not gags,
they're not seen only from the left side, or the right side, or...
You know, [stammers] they don't just show up for five minutes.
This is the cast.
-[man] Ready? -Clap test.
[Neil] I don't think puppeteers are well-known
translation.ko: 인형극 배우가... 유명하진 않죠 숨어서 하는 일이니까요

translation.en: by nature of their job, that they are hidden.
Uh, and I don't think... there's very few famous puppeteers. It is an art where you choose to hide.
translation.ko: 유명한 인형극 배우는 별로 없어요 나를 숨기기로 한 예술이죠

translation.en: And I very much I think it's like a musician,
that you have an instrument, but you play a beautiful tune on it.
translation.ko: 악기가 있고 아름다운 곡을 연주하는데 우리 모두 그걸 들어요

translation.en: But we all listen to the... we all listen to tune.
translation.ko: 아름다운 곡을 연주하는데 우리 모두 그걸 들어요

translation.en: It's the tune we remember. It's not necessarily the piano it was played on.
translation.ko: 우리가 기억하는 곡이죠 꼭 피아노일 필요는 없어요

translation.en: It's the-- the character that-- that lives and has its own life.
translation.ko: 살아 숨 쉬고 자기 인생을 사는 캐릭터를 연주하죠

translation.en: [Olly] People were telling stories with puppetry long before they decided to come up and act,
translation.ko: 사람이 직접 연기하기 한참 전에 인형으로 이야기를 전하곤 했어요

translation.en: because they were too frightened to act,
because they were trying to represent all the ancient gods
translation.ko: 온갖 고대 신과 신화를 연기하려고 했으니까요

translation.en: and all the myths.
We're just bringing back with the current technologies and sort of mythology
translation.ko: 그걸 현대 기술과 일종의 신화와 접목한 것뿐이에요

translation.en: that we've got this desire to explore these different story lines,
translation.ko: 이 신화의 다른 줄거리를 탐험하고 싶었어요

translation.en: but we're just being able to do it through Netflix and through...
[chuckling] animatronics.
As a child, I endlessly drew Jim Henson content and Star Wars content.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 짐 헨슨 작품이나 '스타워즈'를 엄청 그렸어요

translation.en: Drawings. I used to write stuff and model stuff in plasticine.
translation.ko: 그림도 그리고 글도 쓰고 점토로 모형도 만들고 그런 거에 푹 빠져 있었어요

translation.en: I was obsessive about both those things.
translation.ko: 점토로 모형도 만들고 그런 거에 푹 빠져 있었어요

translation.en: And, uh, I've been very blessed, very lucky.
Three, two, one...
At the age of two, I saw puppets on television for the first time,
and I was like, "I need to do that." Straightaway, "That's what I want to do for life."
translation.ko: 저도 꼭 하고 싶었죠 평생 하고 싶다고 생각했어요

translation.en: And I did it from that point on.
My dad gave me a book when I was growing up,
translation.ko: 어릴 때 아버지가 책을 하나 주셨어요

translation.en: and this book was Fairies, and it was illustrated by Brian Froud.
[Neil] All the work that I've ever seen Hensons do is, in form, what I do now,
translation.ko: 제가 보고 들은 헨슨의 작품을 지금 제가 해요

translation.en: and, strangely full circle, here I am
doing what inspired me in the beginning.
translation.ko: 제가 감명받은 걸 제가 하고 있어요

translation.en: [Simon] The point is with puppetry is that it's a medium,
it's an art form in itself, and that's what you're watching.
translation.ko: 그 자체가 예술 형태라는 거예요 그걸 보는 거죠

translation.en: It helps you to stay slightly detached and think about it a bit more.
translation.ko: 살짝 떨어져서 좀 더 생각하게 해 줘요

translation.en: You don't just get hypnotized by looking through a window, you know?
translation.ko: 그냥 창문을 들여다보고 푹 빠지진 않죠

translation.en: You're looking at something which is a... a representation.
This is one of our first rehearsals for the puppet show.
translation.ko: 우리 인형극 첫 리허설 중 하나를 할 건데

translation.en: It's the puppet show that the Heretic and the Wanderer,
um, in the Circle of Suns, are going to do for the Gelflings,
translation.ko: 태양들의 서클에서 겔플링들에게 길을 보여 주려고

translation.en: to basically show them the way.
translation.ko: 태양들의 서클에서 겔플링들에게 길을 보여 주려고 뭔가를 할 거예요

translation.en: Show them what needs to be done, what should happen,
translation.ko: 뭘 해야 하는지 무슨 일이 일어날지

translation.en: and how the world of Thra should be in this crazy little puppet show.
translation.ko: 트라 세계가 어떻게 될지 보여 줘요 재미있는 인형극으로요

translation.en: We have this great young puppeteer called Barnaby Dixon
translation.ko: 바너비 딕슨이라는 젊고 뛰어난 인형극 배우가 있는데

translation.en: who's, um... who does YouTube, um, puppets with his fingers.
[man] It carries the spirit of Thra, and when wielded by Gelfling,
translation.ko: 트라의 정신을 싣고 있지 겔플링이 이 검을 휘두르면

translation.en: holds the power to unite the seven clans and defeat the Skeksis.
translation.ko: 일곱 씨족을 하나로 모아 스켁시스를 격파할 힘을 발휘한다

translation.en: When I teach puppetry,
translation.ko: 인형극을 가르칠 때 항상 세 가지 요소가

translation.en: I always tell people there are three main elements.
translation.ko: 인형극을 가르칠 때 항상 세 가지 요소가 중요하다고 해요

translation.en: Manipulation of the puppet, voices, and your acting.
And of the three, the acting is by far the most important.
translation.ko: 세 번째인 연기가 가장 중요한 거고요

translation.en: When someone's a strong actor like Becky is,
it comes through.
[Becky] The first few scenes that I did with Deet, I was still freaking out a lot,
translation.ko: 디트를 연기한 처음 몇 장면에선 눈앞이 캄캄했어요

translation.en: but the first scene that I did with Deet and Hup,
translation.ko: 그런데 디트와 헙이 같이 나오는 첫 장면에선

translation.en: I was way more relaxed, and it was nice to have somebody else there.
translation.ko: 훨씬 안정됐죠 누가 같이 있어서 좋았어요

translation.en: [Olly] Despite being fantasy characters, the majority of them,
particularly the Gelfling, we've got to bring this naturalism to them
translation.ko: 대부분을, 특히 겔플링을 극과 맞물리게 하려면 사실적으로 표현해야 해요

translation.en: to engage with the drama of everything.
translation.ko: 극과 맞물리게 하려면 사실적으로 표현해야 해요

translation.en: And it's got to be believable.
I mean, it's not like you've even got two nice, colorful characters
translation.ko: 그럴듯해야 하고요 그냥 하얀 배경에 화려한 캐릭터 둘이 나온다고 매료되는 게 아니에요

translation.en: just against the white backdrop and you're enthralled by them.
translation.ko: 화려한 캐릭터 둘이 나온다고 매료되는 게 아니에요

translation.en: This is a whole universe.
You know how hard it is to hold your hand up like this,
even for five minutes?
And they're doing it with, you know, 20, 30 pounds on top of it,
and then acting emotionally and...
you know, you take on the emotions of the character that you're playing.
translation.ko: 내가 연기하는 캐릭터의 감정을 느끼는 거예요

translation.en: It's... it's intense.
When I read these scripts, I thought, "My God.
The acting skills required...
this is not just funny Muppet-y."
To come to this, we had to learn another language,
translation.ko: 여기까지 오려고 또 다른 언어를 배워야 했어요

translation.en: because the Gelflings, particularly, require stillness,
translation.ko: 겔플링은 특히 이런 것들이 필요하거든요 고요함과 정교함

translation.en: precision...
subtlety.
[Taron] You indulge in an illusion.
Everyone apart from the youngest members of the audience know that they are looking at an inanimate object.
translation.ko: 아주 어린 관객만 빼고 모두 무생물을 보고 있다는 걸 알아요

translation.en: But through a collection of great performers and great makers,
translation.ko: 하지만 훌륭한 연기와 제작이 합쳐진 덕분에

translation.en: the audience are able to invest in this thing
and believe it's real life, and there's something really magic about that.
To bring these characters to life, first you look at them,
'cause they're already created, unlike when acting on screen
translation.ko: 이미 만들어진 거잖아요 카메라 앞에서 연기하면서

translation.en: and you chose your costume, the way you walk, move.
translation.ko: 의상, 걸음걸이, 움직임을 정하는 것과 달라요

translation.en: There's the way that they look,
and then there's a huge part of it that is dictated by the puppeteer.
They decide when the character's suddenly shouting, aggressive,
translation.ko: 그들이 캐릭터가 언제 갑자기 소리치고 공격할지

translation.en: or whether they look like they're taken aback by something.
translation.ko: 그들이 캐릭터가 언제 갑자기 소리치고 공격할지 아니면 허를 찔린 것처럼 할지 정하니까

translation.en: And so, the performance really takes place within certain parameters that are... are shaped a lot by the puppeteer,
translation.ko: 인형극 배우가 거의 정해 놓은 범위에서 연기하게 되죠

translation.en: which is why Louis has been working with them as actors.
[Alice] I have to eventually come to the point with every character
translation.ko: 모든 캐릭터의 표정을 무의식적으로 만들 정도가 돼야 해요

translation.en: where I can make faces without thinking,
and I think happy and my hand just does it.
As I'm showing you this, she's...
she's...
you know, she's thinking, she's emoting, she's...
You know, she can be scared, she can be...
thoughtful, she can... she can be sad.
[Victor] When someone else is doing your eyes and you have a sad moment where you close the eyes,
translation.ko: 누가 눈을 찍고 있는데 슬픈 순간이라 눈을 감았다가...

translation.en: and then, when you come out of it,
either they have to kind of catch it when you come up,
or maybe they come out early and that forces you to come up,
translation.ko: 카메라가 따라오거나 인형이 카메라를 따라갈 텐데

translation.en: but because I'm controlling it, it all feels real
translation.ko: 제가 조종하는 거라 전부 진짜 같아요 타이밍이 진짜 같죠

translation.en: and the timing feels real.
translation.ko: 전부 진짜 같아요 타이밍이 진짜 같죠

translation.en: With a Muppet, you're so used to going like that.
Now, on these things, that doesn't quite look right.
It looks like he's riding a horse to Banbury Cross,
translation.ko: 밴버리 크로스에 말을 타고 가는 것 같죠

translation.en: but it is just the movement translating from your own walk
with a bit of something in it to make him work.
And just keeping them ali--
I found when I'm performing Rian, it's almost like I can't let him keep still.
translation.ko: 저는 리안을 연기할 때 거의 가만히 두지를 못해요

translation.en: I have to, while I'm with him,
I just have to sort of just change the weight of where he's standing.
translation.ko: 리안이 그냥 서 있을 때도 무게 중심이라도 옮겨야 해요

translation.en: I'm not afraid.
Naturally, when she looks around, the shoulders kind of go with her,
translation.ko: 주변을 볼 때 자동으로 어깨가 따라가는데

translation.en: but I don't think that looks very natural.
So, if I have an assist, I'll get them to do both hands and I'll hold her body still.
translation.ko: 그래서 다른 손으로 몸이 안 움직이게 잡아요

translation.en: Puppets are funny because they can kind of do nothing...
but make you believe they're doing everything.
So, like, just a... just a tilt of the head
and you read an emotion,

What Louis has done is super-human, but to the benefit,
translation.ko: 루이는 초인적인 일을 한 거죠 그걸 통해

there will be a house energy.

translation.ko: 드라마 전체를 알고 소품을 어디에 쓰는지 다 아는 사람이 있으면

translation.ko: 각본과 제작도 돕고... 그냥 다 해요

translation.ko: 캐릭터와 인형을 다루는 법을 당연히 정말 많이 연구하고요

translation.ko: 인형과 캐릭터를... 개선하는 방법을 종종 제시하기도 해요

translation.en: improve the puppets and improve the creatures
translation.ko: 개선하는 방법을 종종 제시하기도 해요 원래 자기 전공도 아닌데 그게 참 대단한 것 같아요

translation.en: that I find quite fascinating, considering that's not his traditional background.
translation.ko: 원래 자기 전공도 아닌데 그게 참 대단한 것 같아요

translation.en: He's not afraid that they're puppets, which sounds a bizarre thing.
translation.ko: 인형이 배우라서 이상할 텐데 루이는 불편해하지 않더라고요

translation.en: You work on many shows and things where it's,
"Well, it's a puppet, it's going to do this, and it's gonna be a problem."
translation.ko: 인형이니까 이럴 거고 문제가 될 거라고 하는데

translation.en: But when a character walks into a room,
he and Erik, they shoot it as if it was a human actor.
translation.ko: 루이와 에리크는 인간 배우인 것처럼 찍어요

translation.ko: 루이는 성에 안 차면 어떻게 하자고 얘기해요

translation.ko: 그냥 다시 해 보라고 하지 않고 자세히 설명하죠

translation.en: It's, like, "No, but how about this?"
And his ideas are brilliant,
and he has given us loads of ideas of how things could look and how they could be.
translation.ko: 어떻게 구현할지에 대해 아이디어도 정말 많아요

translation.en: [Javier] We're in this hybrid place where we're neither a feature, nor a television show,
translation.ko: 복합적인 작품이에요 영화도 아니고 TV 드라마도 아니죠

translation.en: and having somebody like Louis at the top of that,
translation.ko: 루이 같은 사람이 가장 위에 있고

translation.en: the way that he works made it really possible for us to create freely.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 진행된 덕에 자유롭게 창작할 수 있었어요

translation.en: We knew what we could write that was gonna get on screen,
translation.ko: 작가들이 쓴 대로 스크린에 오를 줄 알았죠

translation.en: because we knew the guy who was gonna be shooting it.
He was there in the room with us, you know.

that is good with these big, big, massive projects,
translation.ko: 규모가 큰 프로젝트를 유독 잘 해내요

translation.en: and he's just one of those. There's like a handful of them.
translation.ko: 루이가 그런 드문 사람 중 하나죠

translation.en: [Simon] Louis Leterrier has made, essentially, five feature films
translation.ko: 루이 르테리에는 사실상 장편 영화 5편을 만든 셈이고

translation.en: and they're all gonna drop at once and form this expansive prequel
translation.ko: 동시에 내놓을 거예요 30여 년 전에 나온 영화의 프리퀄을

translation.en: to a film that came out 30-odd years ago.
translation.ko: 30여 년 전에 나온 영화의 프리퀄을 방대하게 만들었고요

translation.en: It's brilliant. It's so amazing, and it's gonna blow people away, you know.
translation.ko: 정말 대단하고 놀랍고 다들 매료될 거예요

translation.en: Those are the risks that need to be taken.

translation.ko: 계속 안전하게 가면 모든 게 너무 뻔해져요

translation.en: [Peter] The thread that keeps it all going was Louis,
and I also like to think the fact that it is Dark Crystal,
the spiritual thread comes right from Jim all the way through, and Brian as well.
translation.ko: 줄곧 짐과 브라이언에게서 정신적인 힘을 받은 것 같고요

translation.en: I like the darkness that's embraced with The Dark Crystal.
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈'이 담고 있는 어둠이 정말 마음에 들어요

translation.en: I really do. I think sometimes we can sanitize
translation.ko: '다크 크리스탈'이 담고 있는 어둠이 정말 마음에 들어요 가끔 너무 건전하게 만들어서

translation.en: and spoon-feed children and young adults a bit too much.
[Taron] Something about that period in the '80s
meant that there was a spate of films that were kind of tinged with darkness.
translation.ko: 어두운 기운이 있는 영화가 잇따라 나왔죠

translation.en: Not gratuitously so...
-just sort of something... -[growls]
a little dangerous and other-worldly.

translation.ko: 딸이 봤으면 하는 영화는 꼭 보여 주는 편이에요

translation.en: so I took her through all the Amblin movies
and we watched all the formative movies of my childhood,
translation.ko: 제가 어릴 때 본 영화도 전부 같이 봤는데

translation.en: one of which was Dark Crystal.
She watched it and really liked it. It frightened the life out of her.
translation.ko: 딸이 보고 참 좋아했어요 간 떨어지게 놀라더라고요

translation.en: [Javier] The alchemy of working with creatures in a story that we all knew as kids,
translation.ko: 어릴 때부터 다들 아는 이야기의 캐릭터를 다루는 일은 매력적이죠

translation.en: that has this amazing mythical resonance for us...
translation.ko: 전설에 대한 공감대 같은 게 있어요

translation.en: The puppets can be satirical, the puppets can be emotional,
the puppets can say things we never got to say to our parents, what we wish we had.
translation.ko: 부모님께 하면 안 되지만 하고 싶은 말도 할 수 있죠

translation.en: Or that our parents never got to say to us but we wish they had.
translation.ko: 부모님이 우리한테 할 수 없지만 하고 싶은 말도요

translation.en: [Jason] I've been shocked lots of times, not just once or twice,
translation.ko: 정말 여러 번 충격받았어요 한두 번이 아니죠

translation.en: that this is going to go out and be watched by families
because it's sometimes very dark, and very disturbing,
and very edgy.
And if it was live human beings, you might shy away from some things they're doing.
But then I remind myself how dark Grimm's Fairy Tales are, and very...
translation.ko: 돌이켜 생각해 봤죠 그림 동화가 얼마나 어두운지

translation.en: and how... how resilient children are, and how we over-protect them,
translation.ko: 애들이 얼마나 잘 회복하고 얼마나 과보호 받는지를요

translation.en: uh, and the power of narrative like this.
But it's... it's certainly not a gentle touch.

I like the darkness of the original Dark Crystal,
and the ethos of that has bled into our prequel.
We have a real respect for the younger audience,
which is that you don't have to shield them from everything uncomfortable.
translation.ko: 불쾌한 것으로부터 매번 보호할 필요는 없죠

translation.en: You actually have to let people experience
some of, like, these grittier aspects of the world that we live in,
translation.ko: 우리가 사는 세계의 불쾌한 면을 사람들이 경험하게 해야 해요

translation.en: and maybe the world becomes a little less scary because of that.
translation.ko: 그 덕에 세상을 덜 무서워할지도 모르죠

translation.en: [Ted] One of the things that I love about fantasy worlds
translation.ko: 제가 판타지 세계를 좋아하는 이유 중 하나는

translation.en: is the breakdown of sort of our own world segregations.
translation.ko: 현실 세계 안의 차별을 붕괴시키기 때문이랄까요?

translation.en: [Halle] So, I love that we have this intellectual, strong female character
translation.ko: 지적이고 강한 여성 캐릭터가 있어서 좋아요

translation.en: that actually comes from a political background,
and yet is able, through her knowledge and her curiosity,
to.. to question it and challenge it,
and is smart and strong.
[Helena] I've never worked on anything where there's been so many brilliant lead female roles,
translation.ko: 우수하고 주도적인 여성 역할이 이렇게 많은 작품은 처음이에요

translation.en: and this is packed full.
[Vivian] This is the first studio that I've been in
translation.ko: 여기가 제가 일한 첫 번째 스튜디오인데

translation.en: where we went to the meetings and we were just looking at all women.
[Natalie] It is feminist insofar, and I mean that in a sense of equality.
translation.ko: 평등이라는 의미에서 어느 정도 페미니즘이 있어요

translation.en: It's actually scary that message is still necessary and relevant now
translation.ko: 30년이 지나서도 여전히 그 메시지가 필요하고 유의미하다는 게 사실 무서운 일이죠

translation.en: actually, 30 years on.
translation.ko: 필요하고 유의미하다는 게 사실 무서운 일이죠

translation.en: You'd like to think that that would be historical
but it's not, it's still contemporary.
[Javier] Each clan has its own Maudra,
and then there was an All-Maudra over all of them.

The Spriton bless the All-Maudra.
[Javier] And ultimately, that's the magic of The Dark Crystal
is a group of people,
translation.ko: 결국 그게 '다크 크리스탈'의 매력이에요 수많은 사람이 협력해서 창의적인 걸 만들어 냈어요

translation.en: all of them brought their A-creative-game to this thing
translation.ko: 수많은 사람이 협력해서 창의적인 걸 만들어 냈어요

translation.en: at every level, from design, production, writing, direction,
and every time you see one unit of what they created,
everything implies the existence of a great universe behind it,
translation.ko: 그 뒤에 있는 큰 우주의 존재가 느껴져요

translation.en: and you get to, in your own mind, go and live in that universe for as long as you want.
translation.ko: 그리고 우리 마음은 그 우주에 원하는 만큼 머물죠

translation.en: [Toby] We brought everything we could,
the skills, the imagination, the technique
um, from truly, you know, astounding artists.
[Taron] Ninety-five percent of this production
translation.ko: 이 작품의 95%는 짐 헨슨의 원작 영화와

translation.en: has been created in exactly the same way that Jim Henson's original film was,
translation.ko: 이 작품의 95%는 짐 헨슨의 원작 영화와 똑같은 방식으로 만들어졌어요

translation.en: and that was very important to me as a fan of the original,
translation.ko: 원작 팬으로서 저는 그게 정말 중요했죠

translation.en: and I think the fact that Netflix, Louis, the Hensons,
translation.ko: NETFLIX, 루이, 헨슨 컴퍼니 등 모두가 이 시리즈의 정통 방식을

translation.en: everyone's been very committed to that authentic way of making the series.
translation.ko: NETFLIX, 루이, 헨슨 컴퍼니 등 모두가 이 시리즈의 정통 방식을 정말 충실하게 따라 줬어요

translation.en: I think it's wonderful to re-visit something that Jim did 35 years ago,
translation.ko: 짐이 35년 전에 한 일을 다시 찾게 돼서 정말 좋았어요

translation.en: which was, you know, one of the most remarkable things that he ever achieved.
translation.ko: 짐이 35년 전에 한 일을 다시 찾게 돼서 정말 좋았어요 짐의 업적 중에서도 손꼽히는 작품이죠

translation.en: [Lisa] I'm so proud because I really believe it does look like the feature.

because we're doing so many more locations,

translation.ko: 더 많은 씨족... 더 다양한 겔플링을 만들었거든요

translation.en: We have dozens and dozens of puppets this time around,

translation.ko: 이번 작품에 수많은 인형을 썼고요 정말 방대해요

translation.en: And I'm happy that not only we could make it like the feature,
translation.ko: 정말 방대해요 영화처럼 만들었을 뿐 아니라 더 방대하게 만들어서 기뻐요

translation.en: but we could make it even... even bigger.
translation.ko: 영화처럼 만들었을 뿐 아니라 더 방대하게 만들어서 기뻐요

translation.en: And I think it's just great that my sister Lisa, you know, picked up the torch
translation.ko: 제 언니 리사가 아버지 뒤를 이어서 정말 좋아요

translation.en: and has carried it through to the most extraordinary end point.
Its exciting to have brought puppetry to this point.
translation.ko: 인형극을 여기까지 끌고 오게 돼서 정말 기뻐요

translation.en: My own kids have always been a part of, uh, the creative process, I suppose.
translation.ko: 제 아이들은 창작 과정에 항상 참여하는 것 같아요

translation.en: Uh, my oldest two daughters have always been people that I can bounce a lot of things off of.
translation.ko: 큰딸이랑 둘째 딸에게 항상 많은 걸 물어봐요

translation.en: It's kind of the most exciting challenge that we've tackled so far.

translation.en: [Toby] And I think Jim Henson would have just been delighted
